raw_entry:
LEWIS GREEN, of Pr. Geo, Co; 460
acs. (N. L.), Surry Co; on N. side of
Nottoway River; beg. ar mouth of Stony
Cr; to the South Wester Sw; adj. John
Guillum; & Major Robert Bolling; 22
Feb. 1724, p. 170. 40 Shill.

JOHN SMALL, 203 acs. (N. L.).
Up. Pat. of Nansemond Co; in the
Maple Pocoson; adj. Thomas Speight;
& Daniel Pugh's line; on the Timber
Pocoson; 31 Oct. 1726, p. 45. 20 Shill..

JOHN JONES, 75 acs. (N. L.), New
Kent Co., in St. Paul's Par; beg. at
Capt. Dangerfield's, near sd. Jones,
plantation; down S. br. of Crump's Cr;
to mouth of Gentry's Br; on Gentry's
line; 11 July 1719, p. 440. Imp. of 2
pers: John Ducker & George Brasfield.

WILLIAM WILLIAMS, 400 acs., on
8. side of the main Black Water Swamp;
by run of Holloway Sw; 24 Apr. 1703,
p. 519. Trans. of 8 pers: Note: 8
tights paid for to Wm, Byrd, Esqr.,
Auditor.

JAMES TERRY, 418 acs., in Pamunkey Neck; K. & Q. Co., in St. John's
Par; adj. Thomas Carr; & Macon's line:
25 Apr. 1701, p. 356. Imp. of 9 pers:
Richd. Drake; John Woodris, Anthony
Bouswell, Luke Wynn, Robert Buttris,
Sarah Couch, John Hearth, Edward
Powell, Thomas Coakes.

EDWARD RIPPING, RICHARD
HICKMAN & RALPH GOUGH, of
Williamsburgh; 10,000 acs. (N. L.),
Spotsy]l. Co; on S. side the Rappidan
(Riv.); adj. patent of sd. Ripping; &
cor. of the Octana tract; 23 July 1722,
p. 151. 50 Lbs.

SAMUEL GENTRY, 196 acs. (N.
L.), Hanover Co; on both sides of
Beech Cr; adj. Mr. ‚Äö√Ñ√≤Alves' cor; William
Harris' line; & line of Drummond &
Scott; 22 Feb. 1724, p. 145. 20 Shill.

STEPHEN: SAMPSON, 211 acs.,
Chas. City Cb., in Westopher- Par; N.
side of James River, 23 Oct. 1703, p.
578. Adj. John Rayster (or Royster) ;
& Jonas Liscomb. Granted John Blackburne, 28 Apr. 1691; now granted by
order, &c. Trans. of 5 pers.* Note:
Paid Wm. Byrd, Esqr., Auditor for 5
rights.

HENRY POWERS, of Jas. City Co;
250 acs. (N. L.), Is. of Wight Co; on
W. side of the Flatt Sw; 18 Feb. 1722,
p. 17-4. 25 Shill.

WILLIAM LACEY, 474 acs.; New
Kent Co., in Blisland Par., 2 Nov. 1708,
p. 704. Beg. at head of Mattadequinee
tun, a br. of Tyascun ‚Äö√Ñ√≤Sw; by lines -pf
land now or late of Hitchman, or Hopkins. Imp. of 10 pers: Robt. Covert,
Steph. Hobbs, Robt. Stubbs, John
Thomas, Tho. Dawson, Femerton Sparks,
Richd. Windsor, John Tyra, -John
Richardson, Tho, Wharton.

THOMAS CHEW, GENT., !600 acs,
(N. L.), Spossyl. Co; on botin sides the
Biw Ren, oa W. side of the Litth
Mountains; on fine deviding Hanover
& Spotsylvania Countys; adj, Major
William Todd, in the County Line; 16
dune 1727, p. 155. 8 Lbs., Money.

JOHN BOROUGH, 200 acs. (N.
L.), Pr. Geo. Co; on S. side the Orterdam Br. or Swamp; on Wood's line; 9
July 1724, p. 73. 20 Shill.

JOSHUA GLASS, 200 acs. (N. L.),
Pr. Geo. Co; on up. side of Mawhipponnock Cr; adj, John Ellington; &
William Stoa; 28 Sept. 1730, p, 531.
20 Shill.

WILLIAM LETBETTER, 340 acs.
(N. L.), Brunswick Co; S. side of
Maherin River; on N. side of Rattle
Snake Swamp; 31 Oct. 1726, p. 64.

TECHARD DEARDEN, 100 acs. (N.
L.}, in Pr, Geo. Co; on E. side of
Low's Br; 15 July 1717, p. 335. 10
Shill.

JOHN DOWNER. of King Wm.
Co., 400 acs. (N. L.), Spotsyl. Co., in
St. George's Par; on N. side the Northanna (Riv.); beg. at Capt. Chris.
Smith's land; to James Taylor's line; on
Thomas Gambrill's line; 16 June 1727.
‚Äö√Ñ√≤p. 93, 40 Shill.

ROBERT BABER, 400 acs. (N. L.),
King Wm. Co., in St. Margaret's Par;
bet. the N. & Middle fork of Reedy
Sw; adj. William Cockerham; & land
of James Cary; 13 July 1726, p. 536.
40 Shill.

HENRY SPRATT, 4102 acs, (O. &
N. L.), Pr. Anne Co., in Lynhaven Par;
in Corotuck Bay; by the run of the
head of Nannes Cr; adj. Dawley's cor.
& bay; down S. side of Little Cr; to
mouth of the Gr. Narrows; 21 Feb.
1720, p. 59. Found within bounds of
1800 acs. granted Henry Spratr, 23 Oct.
1673. 11 Lbs., 10 Shill.

MARK MORE, 400 acs. (N. L.),
Henrico Co; N. side of Appamattock
Riv; beg, at John Patterson, on the
Ould Hunting Path; on br. of Cattail
Br; to Mr. George Archer's cor; 9 July
1724, p. 11. 40 Shill.

JOHN PIGG, 1000 aes., K. & Q.
Co; in the freshes of Mattapony River;
24 Apr. 1703, p. 531. Beg. in path
from William Rickett's house to the
Indian towne; to Capt. William Smith,
Marriner; from his house to his land.
ing; to land where John Barrow liveth,
fr-morly lend of John Pigg: to N. side
of the Ridge Path, dividing this & land
of Mr. James Taylor; alone Watking'
line; to Maj. Payton, &c. Granted
Joseph Haile, 30 Oct. 1686, deserted,
& now gtanted by order, &c. Trans. of
20 pers: Valentine Hughs, Geo. Moudby, Wm. Green, Eliza. Sexton, Tho.
Allen, John Newton,
John Seamor, Robert Satchell, Theop.
Arvy, Robert Logwood, Sam!. Morgan,
Peter Watts, Edward Jackson, Rowland
Simpson, Jacob Butts, Ambrose Conly,
Richd. Roberts, Robert Coultis, Mary
Allen.

THOMAS HOUSE, 247 acs. (N. L.),
Up. Par. of Nansemond Co; on the
Bear branch; 24 Jan. 1717, p. 356. 25
Shill,

JAMES NEVIL, 700 acs. (N. L.),
Goochland Co; south. side of Fluvanna
River; 17 Jan. 1732, p, 537. 3 Lbs.,
10 Shill.

THOMAS COLEMAN, of K. & Q.
Co; 540 A., 98 Per. (Esch. L.), Essex
Co., in South Farnham Par; on N. side
of the Best land Sw; above mouth of
the Reedy Br; along Henry Baker's line;
to cor. of Halliard's; 5 Sept. 1723, p.
234, Escheated from Stephen Benbridge,
glias Benbrick, dec'd., by inquisition
under John Lewis, Esqr., Esch'r., for
420 acs; upon survey returned by Robert
Brooke, Junr., found to contain 540
A. & 98 Per. 2 Lbs. Tobacco, &c.

THOMAS WHOOD, 199% acs. (N.
L.), Pr. Geo. Co; on both sides of
indian Br. of Naumsend's Cr., below
the river path; 15 July 1717, p. 336.
{mp. of 4 pers: John Moore, John
Oughis, Richard Holland, Daniel Mackcall,

WILLIAM REYNOLDS. 297 acs.
(N. L.), Brunswick Co., on the Long
Branch; adj. Ralph Jackson; 28 Sept.
1728, p, 34.

ROBERT POLLARD, JUNR., Gent.,
of K. & Q. Co; 800 acs. (N. L.),
Spotsyl. Co., in St, George's Par; on
W. side of the little Mountains, on S.
side the Piney Mts., & on S. side the
Rappidan (Riv.): adj, Custice's corner;
& Mountague's line; 16 June 1727, p.
151.

PAUL BUNCH, 400 acs. (N. L.).
Hanover Co; on both sides of Black
Haw (Sw.), 9 July 1724, p. 28. 49
Shill.
iAMBROSE JOSHUA SMITH, 479
acs. (N. L.), Hanover Co; on both
sides of Gr. Rockey Cr; adj. Cel.
uy ies line; 9 July 1724, p. 29. 40.
Shill.

JOHN HARROWELL, 183 acs. (N.
L.), Pr. Geo. Co; on N. side of Nottoway Riv., adj. his father Samuel Harrowell; 22 June 1722, p. 113. 20 Shill.
SAME. 200 acs. (N. L.); same locution, & date, page 370.

ELIZABETH WARE, 240 acs., in
Pamunkey Neck; on N. side of Queens
Swamp; 1 Apr. 1702, p. 430. Being
part of land laid out according to the
articles of peace for the Pamunkey
Indians, &c., (as above.) Granted by
order, &c. Trans. of 5 pers.* Note:
5 rights paid for to Wm. Byrd, Esqr.,
Auditor.

ROBERT BLAWS, JOSEPH WOODSON, JOHN WOODSON & JOHN
WOCDSON, JUNR., 400 acs. (N. L.),
Henrico Co; S. side of James Riv., &
on W. side of Fine Cr; on Pleasants'
line; 18 Feb. 1722, p. 158. 40 Shill.

MRS. MARY LIGON, former wife
of William Ligon, dec'd; 383. acs.,
Henrico Co; on N. side of the gr, or
main br. of Procter's (Cr.); 26 Oct.
1699, p. 243. Trans. of 8 pers: Wm.
Ligon, Math. Oakeley, John Clark,
Margaret Roach, Wm. Exaby, Robert
Whitehead, Richd. Feild, John Gilbert.

JOHN PRIDE, 247 acs. (N. L.),
Henrico Co; N. side of James Riv; on
N, side of Deep Cr; & on N. side of
Horsepen Br. of sd. Cr; 17 Aug. 1725,
p. 321. 25 Shill.

EDWARD BOOKER, GENT., of
Henrico Co; 2050 acs. (N. L.), Pr.
Geo. Co; on both sides of Knibs Cr;
‚Äö√Ñ√≤beg. on lower side, above path to Capt.
Anderson's Quarter; 28 Sept. 1728, p.
290. 10 Lbs., 5 Shill,

FRANCIS FLOURNOY, GENT., 400
acs. (N. L.), Henrico Co; N. side of
Swift Cr; beg. on W. side of Tribue's
branch; to E. side of the main br. of
Tomahake Br; 9 July 1724, p. 17. 40
hill.

HENRY BREAZEALE, JUNR., 300
acs., Henrico Co; on N. side of James
River; 28 Oct. 1702, p. 501. Beg. on
N. side of Giley's Cr., cor. of Henry
Breazeale, Senr; on line of Giley; to
Tho. East, Senr. Trans. of 6 pers:
Theodorick Bland, John Leinch, James
Robbison, Elianor Reener; & 2 sights
more paid for to Wm. Byrd, Esqr.,
Auditor,

JOSEPH MEREDITH, 300 acs.
(Lapsed L.), Isle of Wight Co; 13
Nov. 1721, p. 68. Granted Robert
Johnson, 30 Oct, 1669, in Up. Par. of
Nansemond Co., upon condition of seating, &c. 30 Shill.

JOHN PRIDE, 328 acs, (N. L.),
Henrico Co; on N. side of Appattock
ari on br. of Butterwood Cr., parting
sd. Jobn, & land of Anne &. Mary Pride;
17 Aug. 1725, p, 315. /25 Shill., &
Imp. of 2 pers: John Red & Avis Red,

SAMUEL NORMENT, 325 acs. (N.
L.), King Wm. Co; above mouth of
Reedy Sw., on Matapony River; about
34 of a mi. above Powel's ford; 13 Nov.
1721, p. 74. 35 Shill.

JOHN SMALL, JUNR., 52 acs.9(N.
L.), in Up.. Par, of Nansemond Co; at
NE side of a place called The Bear
Garden. in the Desart; by a Cart Path:
25 Aug. 1731, p. 294. 5 Shill.

WILLIAM EDMUNDS, 280 acs. (N.
L.), Surry Co; N. side of Nottoway
River; on S. side of the Cabbin Branch,
adj. Richard Parker, Junr; Benjamin
Clements; & land of the Nottoway
Indians; 13 Oct. 1727, p. 256. 30 Shill.

RICHARD HERBERT, of Henrico
Co; 400 acs. (N. L.). Pe. Geo. Co;
S. side of Moccosoneck Cr; adj, land
he purchased of David Williams; on
line of John Anderson; 28 Sept, 1728,
p. 18. 40 Shill.

JOHN IVY, of Pr. Geo. Co; 100
acs. (N. L.), Surry Co; S. side the main
Blackwater Sw; on W. side of the
Pidgeon Sw; down run of the Meadowy
Br; 23 Mar. 1715, p. 279. 10 Shill.

COL. JAMES TAYLOR, GENT., of
K. & Q. Co., 450 acs. (N. L.), King
Wm. Co., in St, Margaret's Par; on
N. side of Polecat Run; 8 July 1724,
p. 344. 45 Shill.

THOMAS CARTER, 120 acs. (N.
L.), Is. of Wight Co; on S. side of
Nottoway Riv; on W. side of Blow's
Br; 23 Mar. 1715, p. 269. 15 Shill.

JOSEPH WATSON & JOHN WATSON, 400 acs. (N. L.), Henrico Co;
on N. side of James River; on Thomas
Farrar's line; 5 Sept. 1723, p. 243. 40
Shill.

MATHEW CREED, 200 acs. (N.
L.), King Wm. Co., in St. John's Par;
on both sides the Beverdam Sw., on N.
side the North Anna (Riv.); on Mr.
James Terry; & Mr. Wm. Flemon's
land; 20 Feb, 1723, p. 331. 20 Shill,

ROBERT HESTER, 1300 acs. (N.
L.), Hanover Co; on both sides of
Christopher's Ruf; 27 Sept. 1729, p.
419. 6 Lbs., 10 Shill,

LAUGHLAN FLYN, 300 acs. (N.
L.), Pr. Geo. Co; on both sides of
Leadbiter's Cr; by the Poplar Branch;
13 Oct. 1727, p. 278. 20 Shill., & Imp.
of 2 pers: Robert Stoker & Elizabeth
Stoker.

WILLIAM MACKLIN, of Surry Co;
836 acs. (N. L.), Brunswick Co; on
both sides of Iseinglass Cr., of Maherin
River; adj, Thomas Sissom's line; 31
Oct. 1726, p. 47.
